author: Austen Hufford
title: Beyond Broadcom: U.S. Scrutiny Frustrates Other Foreign Deals
text:
Several planned purchases and investments into U.S. companies from Chinese counterparts have been derailed recently after facing U.S. government review.
The Committee on Foreign Investment in the U.S., an interagency group known as CFIUS, grabbed headlines earlier this week when it temporarily blocked Singapore-based Broadcom Ltd.â€™s proposed $117 billion takeover of Qualcomm Inc.
